intro: Triraphis mollis var. humilis, commonly known as the low triraphis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
